intro: Pedicularis verticillata var. chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in alpine environments, often in rocky or well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive spurred shape that attracts specific pollinators. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 cm, with lance-shaped leaves arranged in whorls around the stem.
